channel.title: Difficulty with my hard drive and formatting it using good ol' ms-dos
channel.description: hey im having a major difficulty loading my hard drive: it takes 20 minutes to show any text when my working hd takes 35 seconds (ive timed it and rounded up) can someone tell me how to fix this and also to get the hd recognized as drive c:\ ty for any help

item.title: Difficulty with my hard drive and formatting it using good ol' ms-dos
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

mike121333:

wats a hdd?[br][br][size=1]Posted on: March 18, 2009, 08:21:23 am[/size][hr]oh and zetta wat o ar u gonna load up?

You clearly have no idea what you’re talking about.

[quote=“zettacorn, post:6, topic:267824”]a. im loading ubuntu
b. not really lol[/quote]

Well, you mentioned earlier you wanted to mount a partition as a drive letter. Now we know that you’re using a Linux distro, I can inform you that this is impossible/very stupid to do. If you wish to mount a hard drive, do this:

cd /
sudo mkdir /data
sudo mount -t ufs /dev/sdx# data

Replace ufs with the filesystem and x with the hard drive letter, # with the partition number.

When mounting ntfs, use ntfs-3g to read and write. When mounting FAT16 or FAT32 use vfat.

Edit: hold on ‘difficulty with my hard drive and formatting it using good ol’ ms-dos’

I am very confused now, what exactly are you trying to do? If you need a disk formatted, in terminal: fdisk and mkfs

Read full topic
